title: Ayush Thakur
text:
Hello! I‚Äôm an engineer by choice and heart and I love solving problems. I am not married to any school of engineering and love learning about varying technologies. I am also an active learner of biology and physics.
I have a background in Electronics and Communication Engineering. I haven‚Äôt pursued electronics in a while now in pursuit of ML but in past life have actively built autonomous robots. I feel equipped now to merge both domains of engineering to solve ‚Äúbig‚Äù problems.
Professionally, I am an AI Engineer at Weights and Biases (by CoreWeave). I lead our open source integration efforts primarily. These integrations make it easy for you ML practitioners to get an MLOps stack. Currently I am specializing in building LLM applications and doing model evaluations. But over the span of 5 years at W&B, I have worn multiple hats ‚Äì like leading our Kaggle initiatives, building our most popular courses, and a ton loads of reports that SEO really well. Overall, the technical efforts have contributed to a successful merger of W&B with CoreWeave and I have big plans.
I am also a Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning and a Kaggle Master (notebook).
When I‚Äôm not coding, I enjoy watching anime (Naruto is my all-time favorite!) and sharing knowledge through technical articles. I have started with 3D printing as well. Stay tuned!
Know more about me from here. My external articles and other work are listed here. A detailed account of my projects can be found here.

    






New work on RAG evaluation: RAG Techniques: From Naive to Advanced - a comprehensive guide to Retrieval Augmented Generation techniques.
New work: LLM Evaluation Framework with systematic evaluation approaches using W&B Sweeps.
New work: Building MLOps pipelines for Keras integration with comprehensive monitoring and tracking capabilities.
Gave a course on RAG++: From POC to Production covering practical implementation strategies. Find the materials here.
Open-sourced SwAV-TF, a TensorFlow implementation of self-supervised visual representation learning.

To know more about my projects, please refer to my GitHub profile.
Apart from the work here, I try to contribute to other platforms in the form of writing and open-source contributions. Please refer here for more details.

title: Blog
text:
Welcome to my blog where I share my thoughts, experiences, and tutorials on machine learning, LLMs, and MLOps. I cover topics ranging from technical deep dives to practical implementation guides, with a focus on making complex concepts accessible.
If you‚Äôre interested in specific topics, use the filters above to narrow down the posts by category, or use the search function to find exactly what you‚Äôre looking for.
Feel free to share these posts and reach out with questions or feedback. I‚Äôm always happy to engage with the community!

title: Welcome to My Blog
text:
Hello! Welcome to my personal blog. This is where I‚Äôll be sharing my thoughts, learnings, and insights about:

Machine Learning & AI: Latest developments, techniques, and applications
Engineering: Problem-solving approaches and technical solutions
Career & Growth: Lessons learned and experiences in tech
Life & Learning: Personal reflections and continuous learning journey

I believe in keeping things simple and focused. This blog is my digital notebook where I capture ideas, document learning, and share what I discover along the way.


I‚Äôll be writing about:

Technical deep-dives into ML/AI topics
Career insights and lessons learned
Tools and techniques I find useful
Thoughts on the future of technology




Feel free to reach out to me on Twitter or LinkedIn if you‚Äôd like to discuss any of these topics!
Happy reading! üöÄ

title: About Me
text:
I currently work as aMachine Learning Engineer at Weights & Biases, focusing on building integrations, LLM applications, LLM system evaluations, educational content and more. The crux of my work is to grow our usebase and have played a crucial role in doing so. As one of the earliest hire in the growth team, I have been involved with multiple key integrations, initiatives, projects, and more.


Machine Learning Engineer | Weights & Biases
2020 - Present

Written multiple blog posts and tutorials on Deep Learning, MLOps, RAG, Evaluation and more. Check them out here.
Reproduced research papers and wrote about them. Check them out here.
Develop MLOps pipelines for popular open-source repositories/frameworks/orgs like Keras, OpenMMLab, Meta, XGBoost, and more.
Develop LLMOps integrations with LLM providers like OpenAI, Cohere, CrewAI, and more.
Built and evaluated wandbot, a Q&A RAG based chatbot.
Created courses on LLM applications and MLOps.
Lead the AI team in India and lead the OS integration efforts.
Created and built our Kaggle Ambassador program. Became a Kaggle Notebooks Master in the process.





Google Developer Expert in Machine Learning (TensorFlow Core) (Aug 2022 - Present)
Kaggle Notebooks Master - Created numerous popular notebooks for competitions.





Programming Languages: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch
ML/DL Domains: LLMs, Computer Vision, MLOps, RAG systems
Tools & Platforms: Weights & Biases, Keras, HuggingFace, OpenMMLab
Areas of Expertise:

LLM application development and system evaluations
Building and optimizing MLOps pipelines
Technical content creation
Deep learning model implementations





Bachelor of Engineering in Electronics and Communication Engineering | Netaji Subhash Engineering College
2016 - 2020




Google Developer Group - Volunteer (Nov 2018 - Nov 2019)
Robonix 2018 - Assistant Head for Line Follower competition (Feb 2018 - Mar 2018)





RAG++: From POC to Production
Training and Fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs)




I‚Äôm passionate about open-source collaboration and enjoy discussing innovative ML approaches. In my free time, I love watching anime (Naruto is my all-time favorite, One Piece is love, and Solo Leveling is üî•).
Feel free to reach out to me on Twitter or LinkedIn for collaborations or discussions!
